agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Greencastle

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - PUTNAM COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - PUTNAM COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about family law, collections, or consumer law cases and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. First come, first served.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, and White County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Clay, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk to door and ring bell.
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam County -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the county and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-3:30pm; by appointment or during schedule flu clinics
Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-3:30pm -- Testing: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri by appointment only
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in Putnam County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the birth or death certificate

agency_desc: A nonprofit health clinic that provides family planning services.
service_description: Offers family planning services on a sliding-scale basis for eligible persons. Services include pelvic exam, Pap test, and breast exam, testing and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, and pregnancy tests, including pregnancy verification required for public benefits. Pregnancy tests and condoms are available free on a walk-in basis.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for health services. -- Walk in for pregnancy testing or to pick up condoms.
site_schedule: Wed and Fri 8am-6pm; Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-5pm
Wed and Fri 8am-6pm; Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-5pm
Wed and Fri 8am-6pm; Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-5pm
Wed and Fri 8am-6pm; Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-5pm
Wed and Fri 8am-6pm; Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 7am-5pm
site_eligibility: For pelvic exams/Pap tests: Women of childbearing age -- For STD testing/treatment: Women and men -- Under age 55

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_schedule: School Year: Mon-Thurs 7:30am-4pm; Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-3:30pm
School Year: Mon-Thurs 7:30am-4pm; Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-3:30pm
School Year: Mon-Thurs 7:30am-4pm; Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-3:30pm

School Year: Mon-Thurs 7:30am-4pm; Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-3:30pm
School Year: Mon-Thurs 7:30am-4pm; Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-3:30pm
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: A career and technical education center providing adult education and high school equivalency classes.
service_description: Offers instruction in basic language arts, math, reading, science, and social studies as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Morning and evening classes are available throughout the year.
site_details: Call for class times and to schedule an appointment for the next monthly enrollment session.
site_eligibility: Ages 16 and older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Putnam County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Putnam County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. (Offers sandbags to Putnam County households during times of flooding.)
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Office hours: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm --  After-hours Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office hours: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm --  After-hours Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office hours: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm --  After-hours Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office hours: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm --  After-hours Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office hours: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm --  After-hours Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open; serves Putnam County

agency_desc: Provides recycling information and services.
service_description: Accepts electronics for recycling. Residents can drop off unwanted computers, televisions, cell phones, and other electronic equipment..
site_details: Visit the website or call for details.
site_eligibility: Parke and Putnam County residents only -- No businesses

agency_desc: Provides recycling information and services.
service_description: Offers information about recycling and referrals to recycling programs and services in Parke and Putnam County.
site_details: Visit the website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides recycling information and services.
service_description: Provides Christmas tree recycling free at this location and other sites in Parke and Putnam County. This program begins on December 26 and continues through the end of January.
site_details: Visit website or call for drop-off locations and times; remove all ornaments and do not leave in a storage bag.
site_schedule: April-Oct: Mon and Wed noon-6pm; Sat 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Compostable trees or wreaths only

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk into the white building behind the church; enter through the north door (between the two buildings).
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam County

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam County

agency_desc: A church providing worship services and community outreach, including building residential ramps.
service_description: Builds free or low-cost home access ramps and low-rise steps for persons with limited mobility. Maintains a wait list during the winter off season and follows in needs-based order.
site_details: Call for information or to set up an interview.
site_eligibility: Elderly or any age with a disability -- Renters need approval from property owner

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Delivery: Vary -- Library: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri and Sat 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Putnam County

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Putnam County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Putnam County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Putnam County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Putnam County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for more information
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Putnam County, the Superior Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in to the County Clerk's office for claim forms or call Superior Court for more information.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Putnam County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Putnam County  -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Putnam County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Putnam County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_name: PUTNAM COUNTY PROSECUTOR - CHILD SUPPORT DIVISION
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Putnam County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in to the child support office. -- For payment information, call the Indiana KidsLine.
site_eligibility: Open -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Greencastle in Putnam County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding city government and services.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
site_details: Call or visit website for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Greencastle in Putnam County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Parks: Hours vary based on park and programs
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Greencastle in Putnam County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Greencastle in Putnam County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Putnam County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Greencastle in Putnam County

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Visit website or call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Putnam County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after-hours, call 9-1-1 or Putnam County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Putnam County)

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF PUTNAM COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit mental health association dedicated to promoting community wide mental health and improving the quality of life of residents impacted by mental illness through advocacy, education, collaboration, support services and prevention activities.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF PUTNAM COUNTY
service_description: Provides a court-ordered class for parents who are divorcing, legally separating, or involved in paternity cases where the children will be living in separate households. Parents gain insight and skills that will assist their children to effectively cope with the change. This class is mandated for all separating parents with children under the age of 18. A corresponding course is available for children ages 7-12 and one-time counseling session is available for adolescents.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for schedule information or to register. Course registration must be completed one week prior to class.
site_eligibility: Divorced/Divorcing Persons -- Court-ordered by Putnam County judges

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF PUTNAM COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF PUTNAM COUNTY
service_description: Builds new homes and rehabilitates, remodels, and repairs existing homes for eligible low-income persons in Putnam County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application. -- Voicemails can be left outside of office hours.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-60% of area median income -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education, intervention, and supportive services, including domestic violence and sexual assault victim advocacy, healthy families, and the Putnam County Recovery Coalition.
site_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA - PUTNAM COUNTY
service_name: DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT PROGRAM - PUTNAM COUNTY
service_description: Provides support, education, and advocacy to men and women who have been victims of violence. Services include court advocacy, protective orders, safe shelter, domestic violence education, safety plans, referrals, support groups, on-going support, educational groups, and awareness programming.
site_details: Call and ask for advocate. -- For after hours emergencies, call 9-1-1, 765-655-1295, or county dispatch.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Female, male, or transgender -- Direct and indirect victims of domestic violence

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a non-food pantry and monthly meal.
service_description: Provides personal hygiene, laundry, cleaning, and paper products for those in need. Does not provide any food. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides emergency shelter services for women and women with children, in Putnam County and the immediate surrounding area.
service_description: Provides an emergency homeless shelter for single women and women with children. Includes meals, shower, laundry facilities, and case management. Initial stay is thirty days with extensions that may be granted based on evaluation of personal transition goals.
site_details: Call for availability and begin inquiry and intake process. If a bed is available, and background check comes back clean and meets additional intake criteria, an appointment to meet will be scheduled.
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam, Parke, Montgomery, Hendricks, Clay and Owen County -- women -OR- women with children (ages 17 and under) -- No sexual offenders, persons with a violent felony within the past 5 years, or persons with an outstanding warrant.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and clothing closet.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Pull up to Door #1 and remain in vehicle. -- Clients will be asked name, driver's license, contact information, and number of household members. -- Free blessing box of donated food can be accessed at ANY time in parking lot.
site_eligibility: Living in Putnam County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; be prepared to provide name, contact information, and number of household members.
site_eligibility: Living within the North Putnam School District

agency_desc: A 24-hour crisis intervention agency that provides inpatient and outpatient behavioral health care; mental health and addictions treatment for all ages.
site_name: GRACE CLINIC HEALTH PROFESSIONAL - PUTNAM COUNTY
service_description: Offers primary care services, including prevention services, acute medical care for viruses and infections, and assisting in managing chronic conditions for patients of all ages. Other services offered include immunizations, physicals, and lab services. Services available to all ages. Sliding fee scale available for those who qualify.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A 24-hour crisis intervention agency that provides inpatient and outpatient behavioral health care; mental health and addictions treatment for all ages.
service_name: OUTPATIENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT - PUTNAM COUNTY
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues and their families. Intensive outpatient services are available at this location.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community mental health agency providing mental health and addiction services at locations in Hendricks and surrounding counties.
service_description: Provides a one-on-one evaluation with a licensed mental health practitioner. The practitioner will make recommendations for further services as needed, but continued counseling is not required. A written report is available 7 to 10 business days after the evaluation.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
